post.content:
Word of the Day for Tuesday October 1, 2002 parsimonious \par-suh-MOH-nee-uhs\, adjective: Sparing in expenditure; frugal to excess. 절약(frugal)이 도를 넘어 인색을 떠는 노랑이짓을 하는
His mother became increasingly parsimonious over the years, and even if there were a good doctor around she did not like to pay one. --Willard Sterne Randall, George Washington: A Life
그의 어머니는 해가 갈수록 인색해져 그녀 주위에 뛰어난 의사가 있었음에도 (의료비를)지불하기를 달가와하지 않았다.
He was extremely parsimonious with his words, parceling them out softly in a deliberate monotone as if each were a precious gem never to be squandered. --Michael Riordan and Lillian Hoddeson, Crystal Fire
그는 지나칠 정도로 말을 아꼈는데, 마치 한마디 한마디가 버려서는 안될 귀중한 보석인양 의식적으로 조용하고 단조로운 톤으로 말을 이어갔다.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Parsimonious is the adjective form of parsimony, from Latin parsimonia, "thrift, parsimony," from parsus, past participle of parcere, "to spare, to be sparing, to economize."
네이버사전... parsimonious [psmóunis] a. 1 극도로 절약하는; 인색한 2 (질이) 빈약한, (양이) 적은
Cambridge Dictionary... parsimonious adjective FORMAL DISAPPROVING not generous; unwilling to spend money or give something She's too parsimonious to heat the house properly. My dad's always a bit parsimonious with the gin! FIGURATIVE I think that politicians are often rather parsimonious with the (=do not tell the complete) truth.
post.title: parsimonious
